Sebastopol Center For The Arts

We invite artists to submit artwork for Pulp, Paper, Book, an upcoming exhibition providing a platform for combining works of book makers, pulp wranglers, papermakers and printmakers to exhibit their work. 1st Day Hike at Sugarloaf
Thursday January 01 - 09:00 AM to 02:00 PM

Sugarloaf Ridge State Park

Celebrate the New Year with Sugarloaf Ridge State Park and California State Parks in this annual nationally-held hike! We’ll have two different routes to choose from: a Naturalist-guided, 2-mile family hike, or a 5.25 to 6.5-mile trek to Bald Mountain, which includes a climb of 1,500 feet and featur...

Sebastopol Regional Library

Thursday January 01 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

54 Years of the Annex Galleries
Thursday January 01 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States....

Thursday January 01 - 12:15 PM to 12:15 PM

South Novato Library 931 C Street

Music & Movement Storytime with Join us for a time of music, movement, and stories! We will sing, dance, and wow babies, toddlers and caregivers with stories and music on the second, fourth, and 5th Wednesdays with Ingrid!

08:00 AM

Merry Meritage
Friday January 02 - 08:00 AM to 08:00 AM

The Meritage Resort & Spa

Escape to Merry Meritage and experience a magically festive world at The Meritage Resort and Spa. Enjoy Napa’s largest outdoor ice rink, festive events, and holiday fun for everyone this season. Merry Meritage, a beloved annual tradition for Bay Area locals and families from all over California and...

Community Coffee Tasting with live music by Joslay Jose
Friday January 02 - 09:00 AM to 02:00 PM

Moschetti Coffee

Sample coffee from around the world, browse crafts and confections by local vendors, or enjoy made-to order crêpes. Joslay Jose and friends will play reggae infused pop fusion for your listening pleasure. Music from 10 a.m. to 1 p.m. Coffee cupping, or coffee tasting, is the practice of observing ...

Friday January 02 - 09:00 AM to 11:59 PM

Sebastopol Center For The Arts

Are you part of the Pulp Faction? Do you create sculptures from paper and books? We invite artists to submit artwork for Pulp, Paper, Book, an upcoming exhibition providing a platform for combining works of book makers, pulp wranglers, papermakers and printmakers to exhibit their work. All forms of ...

Kaleidoscope: An Exhibit of Vivid Photographs
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 06:00 PM

Sebastopol Regional Library

Kaleidoscope, An Exhibit of Vivid Photographs by the Santa Rosa Photographic Society, is on display in the library forum room September 22, 2025, through November 15, 2025.

54 Years of the Annex Galleries: Discover a Santa Rosa Institution
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

Celebrating 54 years of art and artists at Santa Rosa's Annex Galleries. The exhibition features a curated selection of over 100 works, highlighting our broad variety of visual art. Included are original fine prints (woodcuts, lithographs, intaglios, etc.), paintings, drawings, and sculpture from th...

Source: Bohemian
BOUNTY: Paintings by Lynn Zachreson
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

Sebastopol Gallery

﻿﻿New watercolor paintings by Lynn Zachreson celebrate the life energy and natural abundance of Sonoma County...pomegranates, figs, vines, apples and persimmons glowing with color, light and texture. Reception: Friday December 12, 5-7pm Artist Talk and Painting Demonstration: December 13, 1-3pm

Source: Bohemian
Downtown Holiday Hen Hunt
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 06:00 PM

Historic Downtown Petaluma

Discover hidden “Holiday Hens” across participating downtown businesses! Each hen is dressed in a festive holiday attire. Pick up your official Hen Hunt map, follow it to locate the hens, write down their names on your map, then return it to the Downtown Petaluma office to enter to win a $200 Shop P...

Source: Bohemian
54 Years of the Annex Galleries
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States....

Pick up your official Hen Hunt map, follow it to locate the hens, write down their names on your map, then return it to the Downtown Petaluma office to enter to win a $200 Shop P...

Source: Bohemian
54 Years of the Annex Galleries
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States....

Source: Bohemian

Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM

4140 Redwood Highway #8 San Rafael

Start Your Day with Joyful Movement: Morning Jazz Dance! Revolutionize your routine and ignite your spirit with our Morning Jazz Dance class! This is more than just a dance class—it’s a vibrant, energetic start designed to flood your body with feel-good endorphins and set a positive, unstoppable to...

54 Years of the Annex Galleries: Discover a Santa Rosa Institution
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

Celebrating 54 years of art and artists at Santa Rosa's Annex Galleries. The exhibition features a curated selection of over 100 works, highlighting our broad variety of visual art. Included are original fine prints \(woodcuts, lithographs, intaglios, etc.\), paintings, drawings, and sculpture from ...

Source: Press Democrat
BOUNTY: Paintings by Lynn Zachreson
Friday January 02 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

Sebastopol Gallery

﻿﻿New watercolor paintings by Lynn Zachreson celebrate the life energy and natural abundance of Sonoma County...pomegranates, figs, vines, apples and persimmons glowing with color, light and texture. Reception: Friday December 12, 5-7pm Artist Talk and Painting Demonstration: December 13, 1-3pm

Our Favorite Toys
Friday January 02 - 11:00 AM to 04:00 PM

Healdsburg Museum

The “Our Favorite Toys” exhibition features toys and photos of the children who loved them. Museum visitors will delight in seeing Barbies, Teddy bears, games, stuffed animals, toy trucks and more. Visitors of all ages can make paper ornaments; take a ride on a wooden rocking elephant; play games li...

Après Bricoleur
Friday January 02 - 11:00 AM to 02:00 PM

Bricoleur Vineyard

Tucked away in an expansive, stunning estate just outside Healdsburg, Bricoleur Vineyards invites guests to step into Après Bricoleur, an intimate seasonal food and wine experience that blends rustic charm with the elegance of Sonoma wine country. This limited-time pop-up launches November 7, in col...

11:30 AM

Baby Village
Friday January 02 - 11:30 AM to 12:30 PM

Petaluma Regional Library

Local nonprofit Better Beginnings for Babies will host these dynamic community circles supporting infant feeding and the postpartum journey. Everyone gets a chance to share. Facilitated by lactation specialists or consultants. No fee.

Source: Bohemian

01:00 PM

Intuitive Movement to Art
Friday January 02 - 01:00 PM to 02:00 PM

THE 222

One expressive process supports another.  In this lightly facilitated experience, we are invited to engage in an intuitive, kinesthetic response to art.  Based on the practice of authentic movement, we will explore how to use our bodies instead of our words in response to visual art. No dance exper...

Source: Bohemian

03:00 PM

Happy Hour Wine Lounge
Friday January 02 - 03:00 PM to 08:00 PM

Tasting Notes

Unwind in the heart of Downtown Windsor at Tasting Notes Happy Hour! Featuring wines from Oak Tree Winery and J.Cage Cellars, it's the perfect spot to sip, mingle, and relax, just steps from the SMART Train. Come for the pours, stay for the vibe.

Source: Bohemian
Beginner's Dungeons & Dragons
Friday January 02 - 03:00 PM to 04:30 PM

Middletown Library

Welcome to a D&D club for kids 8-12 years old! We meet every Friday \(except the last Friday of each month\) from 3PM to 4:30 PM at Middletown Library. Pre-registration is required. Call us at 707-987-3674. https://www.lakecountyca.gov/calendar.aspx?EID=13613

Source: Bohemian

Beginner's Dungeons & Dragons
Friday January 02 - 03:00 PM to 04:30 PM

Middletown Library

Welcome to a D&D club for kids 8-12 years old! We meet every Friday \(except the last Friday of each month\) from 3PM to 4:30 PM at Middletown Library. Pre-registration is required. Call us at 707-987-3674. https://www.lakecountyca.gov/calendar.aspx?EID=13613

Source: Press Democrat
Happy Hour Wine Lounge
Friday January 02 - 03:00 PM to 08:00 PM

Tasting Notes

Unwind in the heart of Downtown Windsor at Tasting Notes Happy Hour! Featuring wines from Oak Tree Winery and J.Cage Cellars, it's the perfect spot to sip, mingle, and relax, just steps from the SMART Train. Come for the pours, stay for the vibe.

Bow-Wow for Books: Read to Zoey, Margey, or Narsi
Friday January 02 - 03:30 PM to 05:30 PM

Napa County Library

Young readers are invited to read to Zoey, Margey, or Narsi-all certified listening dogs. They are great listeners and provide a welcoming environment for kids to practice their reading skills.

Friday January 02 - 05:30 PM to 08:30 PM

Furthermore Winery Tasting Room

The Christian Foley-Beining will be performing Jazz Standards, Latin tunes and also some original compositions. Christian Foley-Beining - guitar, Tom Shader - bass. Kendrick Freeman - drums. We might have also a special guest sitting in.

First Friday @ MAC: Open Mic & Maker's Faire
Friday January 02 - 05:30 PM to 08:00 PM

Middletown Art Center

Join us on the first Friday of each month to talk art, share music, and support local makers! The gallery is has extended hours until 8pm and outside in the garden we have Open Mic and the Maker's Faire. Open Mic: Facilitated by the band 'Climb Axe'. Bring your own instruments. First come, first to ...

Source: Bohemian

Friday January 02 - 05:30 PM to 06:30 PM

Salsa Dance Marin

Learn bachata basics in a fun, supportive environment. No experience or partner needed. Join us to dance and build confidence!

Friday January 02 - 05:30 PM to 06:30 PM

Calistoga Library

Socialize and let your creativity flow at Coloring Hour. Coloring sheets, alcohol markers, and colored pencils are provided.

Source: Bohemian
Christian Foley-Beining Jazz Trio at Hotel Healdsburg
Friday January 02 - 05:30 PM to 08:30 PM

Furthermore Winery Tasting Room

The Christian Foley-Beining will be performing Jazz Standards, Latin tunes and also some original compositions. Christian Foley-Beining - guitar, Tom Shader - bass. Kendrick Freeman - drums. We might have also a special guest sitting in.

Source: Press Democrat

Friday January 02 - 05:30 PM to 08:00 PM

Middletown Art Center

Join us on the first Friday of each month to talk art, share music, and support local makers! The gallery is has extended hours until 8pm and outside in the garden we have Open Mic and the Maker's Faire. Open Mic: Facilitated by the band 'Climb Axe'. Bring your own instruments. Finley Community Center: Santa Rosa Recreation & Parks

Friday January 02 - 06:30 PM to 07:30 PM

Finley Community Center: Santa Rosa Recreation & Parks

Alisse, Lee and Tristan offer deeply restorative sound baths that soothe, uplift, and realign. Join us as we usher in 2026 with intention.

The Lounge at Mercy Reggae Night with Kool Vibes
Friday January 02 - 07:00 PM to 10:00 PM

The Lounge at Mercy

Join us for an epic in-person night filled with smooth beats, good vibes, and nonstop reggae grooves. Whether you're looking to chill or dance the night away, Kool Vibes will keep the energy just right. Grab your crew, bring your positive energy, and let's make it a night to remember at The Lounge!

Friday January 02 - 07:00 PM to 09:30 PM

Luther Burbank Center for the Arts

Our 4th annual Northern Lights is a walk-through wonderland! Here, artistic expression illuminates and transforms the winter night in the LBC Sculpture Garden to fill you and your family with surprise and awe. A self-guided tour along lighted paths Magically illuminated sculptures Trees full of t...

Saturday January 03 - 12:00 AM to 12:00 AM

Petaluma Regional Library

Sonoma County Library hosts a Mock Caldecott contest each December and January to give picture book lovers in our community the chance to participate in the fun of voting for their favorite illustrated books. This year is Sonoma County Library's 10th year of Mock Caldecott. Come into your nearest li...

Napa County Library

Puzzle Exchange
Saturday January 03 - 12:00 AM to 12:00 AM

Vallejo Springstowne Library

Love puzzles? Have extras you've already completed? LOVE the library? Join us for the PUZZLE EXCHANGE! Saturday, January 3rd - ALL DAY \(9 AM - 5 PM\) How to Participate: Take as many as you bring. No missing pieces or parts. No stains, smells, or damage. Enjoy your new puzzle!

Love puzzles? Have extras you've already completed? LOVE the library? Join us for the PUZZLE EXCHANGE! Saturday, January 3rd - ALL DAY \(9 AM - 5 PM\) How to Participate: Take as many as you bring. No missing pieces or parts. No stains, smells, or damage. Enjoy your new puzzle!

Source: Bohemian
Mock Caldecott Voting
Saturday January 03 - 12:00 AM to 12:00 AM

Petaluma Regional Library

Sonoma County Library hosts a Mock Caldecott contest each December and January to give picture book lovers in our community the chance to participate in the fun of voting for their favorite illustrated books. This year is Sonoma County Library's 10th year of Mock Caldecott. Come into your nearest li...

Saturday January 03 - 08:00 AM to 09:00 AM

Vallejo Ferry Terminal

Hanna Recreation Center

Kids Workshop at Home Depot
Saturday January 03 - 09:00 AM to 12:00 PM

The Home Depot (1175 Admiral Callaghan Lane, CA)

Hello! Come join Play Date with Leo and the Home Depot for a kids workshop! This is a FREE, hands on workshop for kids and all materials will be provided. Registration is REQUIRED. https://www.homedepot.com/workshops/\#register We will be building an “Tow Truck.” Hope to see you there!

Saturday January 03 - 09:00 AM to 11:59 PM

Sebastopol Center For The Arts

Are you part of the Pulp Faction? Do you create sculptures from paper and books? We invite artists to submit artwork for Pulp, Paper, Book, an upcoming exhibition providing a platform for combining works of book makers, pulp wranglers, papermakers and printmakers to exhibit their work. All forms of ...

Saturday January 03 - 09:00 AM to 01:00 PM

Sugarloaf Ridge State Park

Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

Sebastopol Gallery

Downtown Holiday Hen Hunt
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 06:00 PM

Historic Downtown Petaluma

Discover hidden “Holiday Hens” across participating downtown businesses! Each hen is dressed in a festive holiday attire. Pick up your official Hen Hunt map, follow it to locate the hens, write down their names on your map, then return it to the Downtown Petaluma office to enter to win a $200 Shop P...

Source: Bohemian
54 Years of the Annex Galleries
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States....

Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM

Yountville Library

Young readers are invited to read to Henli, a certified listening dog. Henli is a great listener and provides a welcoming environment for kids to practice their reading skills.

Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 10:30 AM

Petaluma Regional Library

This presentation is not for sitting - your family will be active characters in these adventures, participating with colorful scarves, instruments, and animals as you move to the sound of language...

Saturday Market at The Mercantile
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 01:00 PM

A Saturday Morning Tradition! Fresh produce, beautiful crafts, live music, and great food options too. Shop for your family, have a picnic, meet your friends, and taste some wine, while enjoying great local music! Rain or shine, year-round!

Source: Press Democrat
Kaleidoscope: An Exhibit of Vivid Photographs
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 06:00 PM

Sebastopol Regional Library

Kaleidoscope, An Exhibit of Vivid Photographs by the Santa Rosa Photographic Society, is on display in the library forum room September 22, 2025, through November 15, 2025.

Source: Press Democrat
54 Years of the Annex Galleries: Discover a Santa Rosa Institution
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

Celebrating 54 years of art and artists at Santa Rosa's Annex Galleries. The exhibition features a curated selection of over 100 works, highlighting our broad variety of visual art. Included are original fine prints \(woodcuts, lithographs, intaglios, etc.\), paintings, drawings, and sculpture from ...

Source: Press Democrat
BOUNTY: Paintings by Lynn Zachreson
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

Sebastopol Gallery

﻿﻿New watercolor paintings by Lynn Zachreson celebrate the life energy and natural abundance of Sonoma County...pomegranates, figs, vines, apples and persimmons glowing with color, light and texture. Reception: Friday December 12, 5-7pm Artist Talk and Painting Demonstration: December 13, 1-3pm

Source: Press Democrat
Downtown Holiday Hen Hunt
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 06:00 PM

Historic Downtown Petaluma

Discover hidden “Holiday Hens” across participating downtown businesses! Each hen is dressed in a festive holiday attire. Pick up your official Hen Hunt map, follow it to locate the hens, write down their names on your map, then return it to the Downtown Petaluma office to enter to win a $200 Shop P...

Source: Press Democrat
54 Years of the Annex Galleries
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 05:00 PM

The Annex Galleries

An exhibition to reintroduce the public to one of Santa Rosa's most established art galleries. Since 1972, the Annex Galleries has offered one of the largest and broadest selections of original fine prints - including color woodcuts, etchings, lithographs, monotypes, and more - in the United States....

Source: Press Democrat
Saturday Market at The Mercantile
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 01:00 PM

A Saturday Morning Tradition! Fresh produce, beautiful crafts, live music, and great food options too. Shop for your family, have a picnic, meet your friends, and taste some wine, while enjoying great local music! Rain or shine, year-round!

Source: Press Democrat
Thrift Store at the Methodist Church
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 02:00 PM

Forestville United Methodist Church

The thrift store at the Forestville United Methodist Church is open on the first Saturday of each month from 10-2.

Source: Press Democrat
Salsa Beginner Marin – Saturday
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM

4140 Redwood Highway #8, San Rafael, CA

**Ready to learn intermediate steps and technique?** Join on on Saturday – Salsa Beginner Marin Are you a beginner who’s always wanted to learn salsa? Salsa classes are designed to help you build a strong foundation. In this class, you’ll learn the fundamental footwork, practice the basic turns, an...

Source: Press Democrat
Dungeons & Dragons Club
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 01:00 PM

Redbud Library

Join us for Dungeons & Dragons every Saturday at Redbud Library. Ages 13 & up. Registration is required. Call 707994-5115 to register. https://www.lakecountyca.gov/calendar.aspx?EID=11124

Source: Press Democrat
Bow-Wow for Books: Read to Henli
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM

Yountville Library

Young readers are invited to read to Henli, a certified listening dog. Henli is a great listener and provides a welcoming environment for kids to practice their reading skills.

Source: Press Democrat

Spanish Music & Movement
Saturday January 03 - 10:00 AM to 10:30 AM

Petaluma Regional Library

This program is presented in Spanish. Spanish Music & Movement is a tour of culture, language, and fun! This presentation is not for sitting - your family will be active characters in these adventures, participating with colorful scarves, instruments, and animals as you move to the sound of language...

10:30 AM

Lego Club
Saturday January 03 - 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM

Middletown Library

Join us for fun with Legos! Free. Registration is required. Call 707-994-5115 to register. https://www.lakecountyca.gov/calendar.aspx?EID=11408

Source: Bohemian
Weekend Family Storytime
Saturday January 03 - 10:30 AM to 11:30 AM

Guerneville Regional Library

Join the Children's Librarian for a casual Saturday morning storytime with rhymes, songs, games and simple crafts. Be prepared to wiggle, learn and have fun!

Source: Bohemian

Our Favorite Toys
Saturday January 03 - 11:00 AM to 04:00 PM

Healdsburg Museum

The “Our Favorite Toys” exhibition features toys and photos of the children who loved them. Museum visitors will delight in seeing Barbies, Teddy bears, games, stuffed animals, toy trucks and more. Visitors of all ages can make paper ornaments; take a ride on a wooden rocking elephant; play games li...

Source: Bohemian
Après Bricoleur
Saturday January 03 - 11:00 AM to 02:00 PM

Bricoleur Vineyard

Tucked away in an expansive, stunning estate just outside Healdsburg, Bricoleur Vineyards invites guests to step into Après Bricoleur, an intimate seasonal food and wine experience that blends rustic charm with the elegance of Sonoma wine country. This limited-time pop-up launches November 7, in col...

Source: Bohemian

Saturday January 03 - 11:00 AM to 04:00 PM

Dutton Estate Winery

A relaxed and elegant garden experience! Your host will guide you through a tasting of our Russian River Valley estate wines. Source: Bohemian

Dungeons & Dragons Club
Saturday January 03 - 01:30 PM to 04:00 PM

Middletown Library

John Ash Sunroom

Start the new year with a moment of creativity and calm. In partnership with 707 Candles, enjoy a glass of Sonoma wine as you craft your own custom candles, inspired by scents of the season. A cozy, hands-on experience to brighten winter days and bring a touch of warmth home with you. Reserve your s...

Source: Bohemian
Dungeons & Dragons Club
Saturday January 03 - 01:30 PM to 04:00 PM

Middletown Library

Join us for Dungeons & Dragons Club every Saturday. Free. Ages 13 & up. We will be playing 5th Edition D&D. Space is limited. Registration is required to attend. Call 707-987-3674 to register. https://www.lakecountyca.gov/calendar.aspx?EID=7306

Every 30 minutes, one winner will be drawn to spin the wheel. Each spin can win up to $10,000 in prizes. 50 tier points = 1 entry.

Source: Press Democrat
Goddess Circle - Sacred Sensuality
Saturday January 03 - 06:00 PM to 08:00 PM

The Unstruck Drum - Center for Shamanism

We will wear PINK to lift the frequency of self-love.

Source: Press Democrat

07:00 PM

It's a Grand Night for Singing
Saturday January 03 - 07:00 PM to 09:00 PM

Jarvis Conservatory

Each program features fantastic professional vocalists as well as the most promising professional talent of tomorrow. Singers from all over the San Francisco Bay Area \(and beyond!\) perform excerpts from opera, musical theatre, cabaret, and zarzuela -- a plethora of well-loved musical favorites as ...

Source: Bohemian
Aja Vu - The Music of Steely Dan
Saturday January 03 - 07:00 PM to 11:00 PM

Mystic Theatre & Music Hall

*A 9pc Band with a 3pc Horn Section, 2 Lead Vocalists and a soulful Rhythm Section that performs the music of Steely Dan with precision and passion. This performance features songs from the album* ***AJA****, played in it's entirety, along with other favorites from Steely Dan. It'll be an amazing ni...

Glitter/Goth
Saturday January 03 - 07:30 PM to 07:30 PM

Arlene Francis Center for Spirit, Art, and Politics

Glitter/Goth is Santa Rosa’s funnest monthly dance event. Featuring 2 opposing rooms of rotating DJs Darkwave/Industrial/Post-Punk/Goth sounds and Disco/Funk/Cumbia/House/EDM and brighter sounds Est. Valentine’s Day 2023…we ain’t going nowhere!

Source: Press Democrat

Flamingo Resort

Dead Roses
Saturday January 03 - 08:00 PM to 08:00 PM

HopMonk Tavern

Dead Roses is a Rock N Roll Tribute band that is currently active throughout NYC playing at popular clubs and lounges. We cover a wide range of popular hard rock from the late 60's to today. DEAD ROSES PRODUCTIONS Along with our network of bands, we provide rock shows at a variety of local venues ...
